body_content.explanation: in a way that is not as important or as closely involved as other people or things:
examples: Politics, at least peripherally, have always been part of the Olympics.
My wife was in charge of this project, but I was only peripherally involved.
The condition has impaired her vision so that she can see objects only peripherally.
The task involves monitoring lights which are either centrally or peripherally located.

body_content.explanation: Medical treatment that is given peripherally goes into the body through the arms or legs, not into the main part of the body:
examples: The patient had to have a peripherally inserted central catheter placed in his arm.
It is administered peripherally as an isotonic solution.
